findings.title: BT - Burns Tokens
findings.description: The owner of the NOVAWCHI contract can abuse the burn functionality to remove tokens from any address, potentially causing users to lose their tokens.

findings.title: TSD - Total Supply Diversion
findings.description: The total supply of a token and the balances of individual accounts are two separate concepts that are managed by different variables in a smart contract. However, the amount subtracted from the total supply does not equal the amount subtracted from the balances, resulting in a discrepancy between the sum of balances and the total supply.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which also decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L11 - Unnecessary Boolean equality
findings.description: Boolean equality is unnecessary when comparing two boolean values.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause a loss of precision.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
